interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Midsomer Murders, Series 7 (Reissue)
Review Date: 2016/05/25
Store: John Nettles  (Actor),     John Hopkins  (Actor),     Sarah Hellings  (Director),     Peter Smith  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Mystery & Thrillers
Product Description: ['“TV gold” —', 'Entertainment Today', 'Welcome to England’s most murderous county. . .  The English village mystery gets a contemporary spin in this hit British television series that has earned a worldwide following. Bucolic settings harbor macabre crimes and eccentric characters that are no match for nice-guy detective Tom Barnaby (John Nettles,', 'Bergerac', ') and his new assistant, Sergeant Dan Scott (John Hopkins,', 'Love in a Cold Climate', '). “Delightful in a murderously charming way” (', 'Leonard Maltin’s Movie Crazy', '). Guest stars include Henry Ian Cusick, Jim Carter, Stella Gonet, Freddie Jones, Cherie Lunghi, and Henry Cavill.  THE MYSTERIES (original U.K. broadcast order)', 'The Green Man', '—Troy passes his inspector’s exam and has one last case with Barnaby.', 'Bad Tidings', '—Barnaby’s new partner gets a baptism by fire with a case implicating Cully’s old schoolmates.', 'The Fisher King', '—A maze of Celtic rites masks a murderer.', 'Sins of Commission', '—The detectives discover a hotbed of corruption within a highbrow literary crowd.', 'The Maid in Splendour', '—A local pub figures in a case involving secret business deals and unrequited love.  Now with SDH subtitles.  Mysteries previously released in Sets 7 and 8.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television/British Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Box set', 'Contributor': 'Richard Holthouse, John Nettles, Renny Rye, John Hopkins, Sarah Hellings, Peter Smith', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'ACRN2128DVD', 'Director': 'Sarah Hellings, Peter Smith, Richard Holthouse, Renny Rye', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Box set', 'Run time': '11 hours and 41 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 7, 2014', 'Actors': 'John Nettles, John Hopkins', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: This is the best series!
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0

Sherlock: The Abominable Bride [DVD]
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Benedict Cumberbatch (The Imitation Game) and Martin Freeman (The Hobbit) return as Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson in the acclaimed modern retelling of Arthur Conan Doyle’s classic stories. But what if this wasn’t the modern day? What if it was the late Victorian period? What if the world’s most famous consulting detective and his best friend lived in a Baker Street of steam trains, hansom cabs, top hats and frock-coats? Welcome to Sherlock in 1895!', 'Bonus Content:', '• Mark Gatiss: A Study in Sherlock – 30-minute “making of” documentary • Mark Gatiss: Production Diary • Creating the Look – Eight inside looks into how different scenes were created in the Sherlock Special • Interview with the writers Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss • Sherlockology Q&A', ']]>']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** Primarily enjoys Comedy and Romantic Comedies, with a growing interest in Mystery and Thrillers, particularly those with a unique storytelling approach. Openness to dramas outside the mainstream continues, suggesting a diverse taste in cinematic experiences.
- **Actor and Director Favorability:** Maintains a strong favor for productions featuring established actors and skilled directors, showcasing a continued appreciation for quality performances and storytelling. Recent interactions highlight a preference for well-regarded TV series.
- **Content Rating:** Prefers family-friendly movies rated PG-13 but is increasingly open to titles that are not rated, indicating a willingness to explore diverse content across genres.
- **Format Preference:** Strong preference for physical media (DVD format), reflecting a dedication to collecting films and series. Continues to engage with content that is highly rated and well-reviewed.
- **Overall Sentiment:** Exhibits a positive outlook towards enjoyable films but applies a critical lens focused on narrative and production quality. Recent feedback indicates a fondness for series that deliver engaging storytelling and compelling characters.
- **Engagement Style:** Engages thoughtfully through concise reviews and ratings, showcasing a willingness to express enthusiasm or disappointment based on expectations. This evolving approach reflects a commitment to finding well-crafted and enjoyable content while maintaining high standards.
